metadata.synopsis: After the party, this companion is still trying to come down from all the energy, and with a good enough bond it is possible for the player avatar to flirt and unlock a romance option.This specific dialog occurs after tieflings have been massacred.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to Laezel during Raider Celebration

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: We must not forget this night. True allies are few.
2.context: NodeContext: She takes a shuddering breath at the end.

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: Celebrate now. Come dawn, we depart.
4.context: NodeContext: She takes a shuddering breath at the end.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: Soon. When you rest, I will come.
23.context: NodeContext: She takes a shuddering breath at the end.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.context: NodeContext: She takes a shuddering breath at the end.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Yes, I must have you tonight.

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: I have seen the kith'raki tear a screaming neogi's legs from its belly to fashion into blades.
60.context: NodeContext: She takes a shuddering breath at the end.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: Yet they could not match your nerve today. It was enough to drive me to madness.
34.context: NodeContext: She takes a shuddering breath at the end.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: I smell their blood on you still. I smell your moisture.
54.context: NodeContext: Said with a bit of a sigh, but not too meanly. She does not like rejection but this is still a more intimate scene

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: A glorious reward for a glorious battle.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: Go on, have your fun. And do not wipe away a single bead of sweat. It's intoxicating.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: How torturous for us both that I'll never get a taste.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: I smell their blood on you still. I'd have liked to have tasted it.
71.context: NodeContext: Said with a bit of a sigh, but not too meanly. She does not like rejection but this is still a more intimate scene

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: Too bad for us both your bunk will be quite busy. Take all the pleasures you can, before dawn brings their end.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: I smell their blood on you still. I smell your sweat.
12.context: NodeContext: Said with a bit of a sigh, but not too meanly. She does not like rejection but this is still a more intimate scene

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.context: NodeContext: Said with a bit of a sigh, but not too meanly. She does not like rejection but this is still a more intimate scene

89.speaker: Player
89.context: NodeContext: Said with a bit of a sigh, but not too meanly. She does not like rejection but this is still a more intimate scene

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: You know the fortune of my company.
65.context: NodeContext: Said with a bit of a sigh, but not too meanly. She does not like rejection but this is still a more intimate scene

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: Another fortune yet stands before you. A warrior's flesh, rarely tasted.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Bah - think if you must. The chance will pass come light of day.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Given our history, I can't believe you're asking. And I can't believe I'm saying 'yes'...
49.context: NodeContext: Said with a sexy, steely confidence.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Then taste it. I want you in my bed tonight.
20.context: NodeContext: Said with a sexy, steely confidence.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.context: NodeContext: Said with a sexy, steely confidence.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: When you lie down for the night, I will come.

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: And I will take what is mine.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I'd love to share my bed with you tonight.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I'd love nothing more, but I'm afraid I can't touch anyone until my engine is fixed.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: A loathsome hurdle. Watching you burn lit a fire in me I could not quench alone.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: I will have to seek relief elsewhere.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Are you asking me for sex?

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: A night such as this calls for flesh to feast on. And I have chosen the sweetest.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: No, I'm sorry. I don't see you as an intimate partner.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: There are, after all, other spreads before me. Astarion looks particularly tempting tonight.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: I will not go long without pleasure.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: There are, after all, other spreads before me.

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: A pity for us you have promised your body to Astarion.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: I hope for your sake he doesn't come too near your neck.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Maybe another night? It could be sweeter for waiting.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: I will take pleasure when I wish, and from whom I wish. Astarion looks particularly tempting tonight.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: I will take pleasure when I wish, and from whom I wish.

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: One day, fortune may favour you.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: You might still persuade me to share the night with you instead.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: I will do no such thing - not when you have turned your back on me so often.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: But come morning, you will wonder.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: You will wonder how my lips might have tasted, how my fingers on your skin might have felt.

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: Oh, but do enjoy yourself this night. I intend to, myself. Astarion looks particularly tempting.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: Oh, but do enjoy yourself this night. I intend to, myself.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: You are a gifted warrior. It was pleasure enough to fight at your side.

13.speaker: Lae'zel
13.text: Vlaakith demands of me no less.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: Mm - if only I might lay claim to my proper trophy.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: A pity for us you have promised your night to Gale.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: I've no doubt he will satisfy your tastes for endless conversation.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: A pity for us you have promised your night to the half-elf.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: I've no doubt she will satisfy your tastes for endless conversation.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: A pity for us you have promised your night to the drow.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: A pity for us both you've turned your back on me so often.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: A pity indeed. Maybe we can make amends some other night?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: That's fine - I'm not interested anyway.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: You are a gifted warrior. It was pleasure enough to fight at your side.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Vlaakith demands of me no less.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: If only you'd earned the right to lay at my side.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: To think you might have known paradise.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: Celebrate now. Come dawn, we depart.

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: Celebrate now. Come dawn, we depart.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: 'Turn your back not to your ally, lest you would see it pierced.' A githyanki dictum.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: A lesson you might have heeded, had your flesh not been weak.

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: Associate as you wish. Indulge yourself at your own peril.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: A lesson taught in flesh and bone this very night. Associate as you wish. Avert your eyes at your peril.
